key_risks: Regulatory penalties for non-compliance with banking norms

controversies: Multiple penalties from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI)

social_issues: Customer service issues leading to dissatisfaction
Unauthorized loans and fraud affecting customers
governance_issues: Challenges in maintaining operational efficiency post-merger

sources.title: RBI Fines Axis and HDFC Banks for Regulatory Violations - Tax Guru
sources.snippet: On September 3, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed penalties on Axis Bank and HDFC Bank for non-compliance with banking regulations. Axis Bank was fined ₹1.91 crore for violating provisions of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, including issues with Know Your Customer (KYC) norms, agricultural loans, and multiple customer IDs.
